quotes: 1965. While at Harvard, her vision of the place of medicine being alongside environmental and human development issues began to take shape.
worked as a consultant to the Ministry of Health in Oslo (1965-67)
as medical officer for the Health Department of Oslo (1968-69)
Deputy Director of the Oslo School Health Services from 1970.
Domestic political career from 1970s: first Norwegian female Prime Minister
In 1974 she became Minister of the Environment, a post she held for five years.
She also reacted decisively and rapidly in 1977 in preventing a North Sea oil platform leak from becoming an environmental disaster.
When first elected in 1981 at the age of 41, she was Norway’s youngest and first female Prime Minister.
Brundtland served three terms as Prime Minister of Norway: from 4th February 1981 to 14th October 1981;
9th May 1986 to 16th October 1989;
9th May 1990 to 24th October 1996.
appointing eight women to her cabinet of eighteen in her second term (1986-89).
and in 1990 introduced the Ministry of the Child as a formal governmental body.
she supported the creation of the European Economic Area in 1991
Criticism befell her in 1992 when she authorised a resumption of commercial whaling,
In her third term as Prime Minister (1990-96),
